<question>



DWTS-Do you think it was fair that Kim was voted off instead of Cloris?



</question>



<answer from>



msmarvel...
Member since: 27 July 2006
Total points: 6982 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



I can't believe Rocco what's-his-name got more votes that Kim.  But I'm sure she doesn't have a big female fan base, and I don't think a lot of guys vote or watch.  To me, she's a Paris Hilton - not sure why she's famous except for maybe her father.  And she's pretty boring when she's talking.



Cloris probably has some die hard older women fans, from back when she was so funny on Mary Tyler Moore.  And she's a lot more interesting than Kim.  Wonder how she'll do is she has to dance a faster dance - she's gonna break a hip or something!



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Yeah, i agree,, Thanks for answering &Have a Good Day...



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Katie
Member since: 10 October 2007
Total points: 8574 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



It's all about the fans.  People seem to love Cloris and are voting for her.  You never know what kind of stunt she's going to pull (like bribing the judges) or what is going to come out of her mouth.



I was surprised that Kim got voted off because I thought she'd have a bigger fan base.  She wasn't the strongest dancer at all, but she also wasn't the worst dancer left.  Maybe people thought the same way I did that someone else would vote for her and used their votes to save someone else (like Rocco) who they thought needed fan support.



As long as the viewers have a choice in the matter then there will always be controversy.  I compare it a bit to American Idol.  There is still debate over whether the right David won last season.  But that's the beauty of a show where the fans have a voice.  As long as you like someone you can vote for them and save them.



</answer>



<answer from>

Member since: 06 June 2007

Kim always talks about how beautiful she is and how talented she is in addition to Sheree...but who is she trying to convince by repeatedly stating that?  herself?

<question from>

Member since: 29 September 2008
Total points: 90 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



What happened to touch the truck??



I remember a show about 4-5 years ago which was hosted by dale winton, or micheal barrymore, cant remember which, and the show was just about a group of randoms, some so determined that they would quit their jobs if they lost, who had to touch a black pick up truck. now, i never remember hearing about who won that show? is it possible 5 years on, the stubborn b*****ds are still touching the truck, waiting for the last person to get tired and give up? and we never see it coz channel 5 got so bored they stopped filming it???

<question>



A question about Kate from Jon & Kate Plus 8?



Does anyone think Kate made up her PCOS because she WANTED to have HOM so she could get all of the free stuff she knew she'd get?



There are lots of perfectly healthy women out there who want to have multiples.  They ask their doctors and the doctors for the meds and the doctors [usually] say no so they go online and buy the fertility drugs with out an Rx from places in India and proceed to take double doses to produce more eggs.



I didn't believe it was possible till I googled it and found a forum where admittedly healthy women were asking each other for advice on how to conceive multiples with Clomid.



</question>



<additional details>



Actually, if  you visit here:



http://web.archive.org/web/*/http://sixgosselins.com



And click through the links to see the changes that were made to their site from BEFORE the tups were born, you'll see that they've been getting loads of freebies from WAAAY back.  Like free clothes, thousands of $$ in free groceries, free cribs, car seats ...



The link didn't work... But if you copy and paste that into your browser you'll get the site.  It's pretty interesting...



Sorry if I offended anyone with PCOS.  That was NOT my intention.  My sister has PCOS and she's been trying forever to have a baby with NO success.  I happen to think Kate gives women with PCOS a bad name (if she does in fact have PCOS).



Kate is a nurse.  Therefore she went to nursing school.  It's possible that she studied up on PCOS in effort to be able to properly deceive an already unscrupulous doctor into giving her fertility treatments when she didn't need them.



</additional details>



<answer from>



Sir J
Member since: 21 June 2006
Total points: 32311 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



You can't "make up" a medical diagnosis, so no. And those treatments are not something you'd go through to get "free stuff."



What I do wonder is when she will stop treating her poor husband like crap and admit she needs some Prozac.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



I dunno.  I'm still skeptical.  But I agree with what you said about Jon and her needing meds.  Though I was thinking more along the lines of a tranquilizer dart.  :-)



</asker's comment>



<answer from>

Member since: 14 April 2007
Total points: 1672 (Level 3)



</answer from>

</answer>

Kate did not want multiplies they actually were contemplating on terminating the pregnancy when they found out it was sextuplets. <answer>



A lot of people give me flak for watching big brother but most of them watch sport s and all kind of pointless cr@p so while it might not be the best use of time, but it's not the mind numbing dumbness of watching people run around with or hit a ball of some description.

It's people interacting and as a person who is interested in people I find it sometimes fascinating, sometimes excruciating and yes at times it can be boring too. It's great see the shallowness, selfishness and stupidity of some people, their small mindedness before going in  and the way others cope with them. Much more interesting than x factor or I'm a celeb.



As for having disabled people and people who look different on, I think it's a good thing to expose people to others that they might not come into contact with on a regular or personal basis in real life.

Whether or not that is what they intend by doing it I don't care but I hope they do continue to make it and get unusual people to go on it.

I'd like to see one where everyone is reasonably intelligent, opinionated and self righteous but with very different opinions and from very different walks of life just to see them have some wild conversations.



Maybe people who need to have their opinions challenged like racists, bigots, homophobes, religious people and the like put in and made to see the stupidity of their ways and the humanity of the people they are prejudice against. - that would be interesting.

<question>



A Tru calling question

What did he mean by that?
AND
Is her sister into drugs again, is that why she got slapped by that hobo-esque guy?

Thankyou xx



</question>



<answer from>



no answerer details



</answer from>



<answer>



[talking about a financial situation Harrison has gotten himself into] 
Tru: What happens if you don't pay? 
Harrison: I'll be in trouble. 
Tru: How much trouble? 
Harrison: Let's just say I may be asking for your help at the end of the night... you know, from beyond. 
Tru: HARRISON! 
Harrison: I'm just kidding. Man, talk to a few dead people and lose your sense of humor...



http://www.tv.com/tru-calling/show/17237...
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0364817/
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tru_calling

Davis was once rescued by Tru's mother, who also had the "gift".  Years ago, Tru's mother tried to warn him of the car accident that was about to happen. He didn't heed the warning, but Tru's mother flattened his car's tires, thus saving his life, but unable to save his spouse.

As for Tru's sister, her character was "pushed into the background" when Jason Priestly joined the cast.  She hardly appeared at all during the second season.  Her drug storyline was never resolved one way or the other.

http://www.youtube.com/results?search_qu...

Thanks for the memories.



</answer>

My favourite episode is the one where Sideshow Bob ran for mayor of Springfield.  They make fun of the election process, people's attitude's towards voting, and they make fun of Rush Limbaugh which is great.  The episode makes alot of good points about today's society.

My personal favorite is from "Journey's End":

Rose: He's not you!
TDr: He needs you. That's very me.

Here's some others I enjoyed:

The Doctor: Back to your mum. It's all waiting. Fish and chips, sausage and mash, beans on toast... No! Christmas! Turkey! Although, having met your mother, nutloaf would be more appropriate.



The Doctor: I don't age. I regenerate. But humans decay; you wither and you die. Imagine watching that happen to someone that you l- 
Rose: What, Doctor? 
The Doctor: You can spend the rest of your life with me, but I can't spend the rest of mine with you. I have to live on. Alone. That's the curse of the Time Lords.

<answer>



One of my favourite quotes from the classic series is from 'The Visitation' when the Doctor is trying to get Tegan back to her own time but misses it by about three centuries.  Tegan turns around and yells at the Doctor: "Call yourself a Time Lord? A broken clock keeps better time than you! At least it's accurate twice a day which is more than you ever are!"

From the new series I can't decide between:
"Goodness me, I'm a man. Yum! So many parts! And hardly used. Oh! Ah! Two hearts! Oh, baby, I'm beating out a samba!" (The Doctor, 'New Earth')

and

"So, physics! Physics, eh? Physics! Phyyyysics! Physics, Physics, Physics, Physics, Physics Physics, Physics, Physics, Physics... I hope you're getting all this down!" (The Doctor, 'School Reunion')

And I loved this quote from 'Blink' so much, I've got a T-Shirt with it printed on it:
"People assume that time is a strict progression of cause to effect... but actually, from a non-linear, non-subjective viewpoint, it's more like a big ball of wibbly-wobbly.... timey-wimey.... stuff."  ; )



</answer>

<answer>



Oh, all good quotes so far!

Wibbly-wobbly timey-wimey has to be one of the best ever.  And also from "Blink" is "The angels have the phone box."

Another favorite, from "Girl in the Fireplace":
Rose:  You're not keeping the horse!
Doctor:  I let you keep Mickey!

And from "School Reunion":
Mickey: Oh God, I'm the tin dog.

Series 4, "The Unicorn and the Wasp":
Donna:  Agatha Christie, in a murder mystery?  That's like meeting Charles Dickens, at Christmas, surrounded by ghosts!
(one of my favorite quotes because "The Unquiet Dead" was the first episode of Doctor Who that I ever saw)

Series one, most episodes, "Fantastic!"  I loved hearing Christopher Eccleston say that.

Just like in series 2, 3, and 4, the way David Tennant says "What? What?!?!  WHAT??"

OH!  And another absolute favorite that we hear in "Utopia," "The Sound of Drums," "Last of the Time Lords," and "Stolen Earth" (and I hope we'll get to hear the Doctor say when Captain Jack and Jenny cross paths for the first time):  Jack!  STOP IT.



EDIT:  Oh gosh, one more that just hit my brain.  Series 3, "Utopia."  Jack is dead on the ground, Martha is attempting to give him CPR when the Doctor tells her to move away.  Jack gasps back to life and says:
"Was somebody kissing me?"



</answer>

<answer>



The Doctor: [About Martha] She fancied me.
Donna: Mad Martha that one, blind Martha, [Looks at the Doctor] Charity Martha.



Rickston: Who put you in charge? And who the hell are you anyway?
The Doctor: *turns* I'm the Doctor. I'm a Time Lord. I'm from the planet Gallifrey, the constellation of Kasterborous. I'm nine hundred and three years old and I'm the man whose gonna save your lives and all six billion people on the planet below. .. You got a problem with that?
Rickston: No.
The Doctor: In that case.. Allons'y!



The Doctor: I just wanna mate.
Donna: You just want TO mate?!
The Doctor: I just want A mate.
Donna: You're not matin' with me sunshine!



Donna: Oi, watch it Space Man!
Doctor: Oi, watch it Earth Girl! Oh, I sound like you!

"People assume that time is a strict progression of cause to effect... but actually, from a non-linear, non-subjective viewpoint, it's more like a big ball of wibbly-wobbly.... timey-wimey.... stuff"

monkeyma...

<answer>



"One may endure a world full of demons for the sake of an angel" (from Girl In The Fireplace). I am actually thinking of getting this tattooed on me because I like this quote so much.



"One good solid hope's worth a cart-load of certainties." (from The Warrior's Gate)



"One day, I shall come back. Yes, I shall come back. Until then, there must be no regrets, no tears, no anxieties. Just go forward in all your beliefs, and prove to me that I am not mistaken in mine. Goodbye, my dear. Goodbye, Susan." (from The Daleks Invasion Of Earth)

"There are worlds out there where the sky is burning, where the sea's asleep and the rivers dream, people made of smoke and cities made of song. Somewhere there's danger, somewhere there's injustice and somewhere else the tea is getting cold. Come on, Ace, we've got work to do." (last words featured in 1989 when Doctor Who was cancelled)

"Excuse me, do you mind not farting while I am saving the world?" (from Aliens In London)



</answer>

7. "Na Na" - Superchick – 3:45



8. "1, 2, 3" - Nikki Cleary– 3:28

<answer>

<answer from>



ally
Member since: 18 October 2006
Total points: 4363 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



I don't know if that's such a good idea. Soap Operas serve a purpose and entertain a pretty big selection of people. Daytime soaps in particular are very well loved by many people. The elderly, stay at home parents, and a lot of women of all ages adore the drama and are very hooked to their characters. Frankly, all the talk shows and reality crap on television all looks the same. In fact, it's getting trashier as the years go by. Soaps provide great storytelling full of romance, adventure, fantasy, drama, and even humour; you really can't get this anywhere else on TV.

That said, the ratings are dwindling each year. It is also pretty cost prohibitive - meaning it's a very expensive medium to keep going.



</answer>



<answer from>



insightf...
Member since: 09 February 2006
Total points: 2116 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



it 's more a question of would what they replaced them with be considerably better , and how/ in what ways(s)?
And even if (some/ "all" ) broadcasters dropped soaps, there are so many new channels on cable that a new 'soaps only' channel would be bound to sprout up!
All those unemployed crews, staff and casts would have to find new work and no doubt they'd band together to produce new work somehow ..



</answer>



<answer from>



Scotters
Member since: 31 May 2008
Total points: 1749 (Level 3)



Contributing In:



Soap Operas



</answer from>



<answer>



I love soaps, but it would probably be a cost saving thing.  Daytime chat shows and game shows are much cheaper to produce... but I really think that network loyalty branches from soaps, so it makes sense to keep them on (as long as people are watching) so that there wouldn't be outcries from angry viewers towards the networks.



</answer>

<question>



Old Days of our Lives?



Hello, I was wondering if anybody would be able to help with this...

Right well when Days of our Lives was cancelled in the UK, we where up to the storyline which showed the Woman in White or The White Woman... She looked as though she had a net curtain over her.



The only thing is, is that when it came back on we were past that storyline by a fair few years lol...

Would anybody be able to tell me who the woman in white was and what happened with the storyline because me and my mother would love to know...  The storyline was in the late 1990's i believe.. though i am not 100% sure! haha

Thank You Very Much...
Ker!



</question>



<answer from>



Jen♥
Member since: 13 July 2007
Total points: 47335 (Level 7)



Contributing In:

</answer from>



<answer>



It was Rachel Blake, Kristen adn Peters mom, here is a link to the story

http://www.soapoperafan.com/days/misc/st...



</answer>



<answer from>



Susanna K
Member since: 21 July 2008
Total points: 1491 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



It is along story but her name was Rachel Blake: the mother of Peter & Kristen Blake. After Stefano killed her husband in a jealous rage he imprisoned Rachel somewhere in Aremid (Dimera backwards) & he adopted Kristen & Peter & raised him as his own.

Jennifer was marrying Peter in Aremid: his hometown & that's when we first saw "The lady in White". I think Kristen or Jennifer convinced her to come to Salem. Then she moved into the DiMera mansion. Later Kristen noticed something "familiar" about her. Then everyone simply asked if she was Rachel Blake & she said yes. She had a confrontation with Stefano in a cave in Paris. She shot @ him & there was a huge explosion caused by a gas leak I think. She is now "presumed dead". I hope she comes back & teams up with Marlena once she's all better & destroy him FOR GOOD!



</answer>

Member since: 26 July 2008
Total points: 434 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I love Hollyoaks at the moment. 
As much as it is a joke to some as most of the cast are pretty, it, in my own has acted alot of other soap actors off the stage. The schizophrenia storyline has been done perfectly and raised such awareness for a subject that is still taboo. The same can be said about the gay storyline between Craig and John Paul. It has been written so beautifully that the issue isn't the sexuality of the characters, more the love story between them.

I love Hollyoaks and it is at the moment beating any other soap for me :D



</answer>

<question from>



Cazz
Member since: 25 March 2008
Total points: 117 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



The young ones (the sitcom) and my family (also a sitcom)?



who is there target audience and why ? and how do they appeal to them  .... any help is much appreciated :)



</question>



<answer from>



guppyruk
Member since: 04 May 2008
Total points: 1639 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



My Family is aimed at "the whole family" the slight sexual innuendos go over the heads of the kids but will give the parents a laugh and the general comedy will make kids laugh.

On the other hand The Young Ones is aimed at a mature audience, its also "alternative comedy" which basically means it doesnt appeal to general audiences.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thanks :) ...... i might actually be able to answer my exam question now :P



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



lochmess...
Member since: 17 January 2007
Total points: 14612 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



I haven't really watched the young ones much, once or twice and wasn't impressed, but am and will always be a lover of My Family.  As far as target audience I would say it's not really for young kids, nor an adult comedy, uses adult themes as most of the jokes come from or around the parents.  A lot of sexual innuendos that would go over the head of kids.  Personally I think it's one of the funnier Brit coms ever made, and has incredible stars.  Zoe Wannamaker iis a star of top quality having been nominated for a tony and lost only because Judy Dench was also up.  Robert Lindsey did a wonderful series playing a detective, so far from the part he is playing in My Family.
It appeals to it's audience by having good writers and good actors and plots.  Also, as far as I'm concered, by being so close to life, but just a litte off, you can believe it can happen, but pray it never does.



</answer>



<answer from>



QI Elf
Member since: 10 April 2008
Total points: 1678 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



The young ones - Mostly students, like what the young ones are



My Family - id say almost anyone, id say it was a family show



</answer>

However I have to say I prefer the American version now!  Its just so much more funnier!  Feel terrible saying that....but Steve Carrell is great.  As there are more episodes there has been more time to develop all the minor characters too, which is great!



</answer>



<answer from>



happihaw...
Member since: 18 March 2007

<answer>

At first, I thought the Americans couldn't do a better job, but I stand corrected. I think they have been able to take a great formula and made it even better.

<question>



ABOUT THE SHOW "THE HILLS"...?



Has anyone else wondered why Lauren doesn't have any friends who aren't Caucasian?  What's up with that?  I heard MTV actually searches for people to cast as Lauren's friends (Audrina admitted that she was cast to play the "friend" roll" and was discovered while sitting at a pool).  LA is so ethnically diverse and it's a shame that MTV chooses to keep "The Hills" all "white".  What do you think?



</question>



<additional details>



Oh and let's not forget that there aren't any overweight people on the show either !  So unrealistic !



It's a known fact that the hills is scripted and fake.  Even Lauren admitted that they sometimes have to re-do scenes.  It is a known fact that Audrina was "discovered" while sitting along side a pool and asked if she wanted to be on a show called "the hills".



Well I do wonder why their places of employment are all "caucasian" too and when they go out to eat the other people eatting in the restaurant are all caucasian and when they go shopping everyone in the store who is shopping is caucasian too.  Just a coincidence?  Yeah right.



</additional details>



<answer from>



hliiza
Member since: 19 October 2007
Total points: 251 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



To Amy L: A lot of reality shows are staged (for plot purposes).  However, there are genuine stuff that happens in terms of relationships/interactions with people.  Especially for those long/dating shows, they were all casted /chosen, usually, they know each other, etc.  (a customer of mine was casted a few years back and told me all about it)

So in this case, Audrina could have been casted off to be Heidi's friend.  Get the drift?  Or if given the benefit of the doubt, she happens to be Heidi's first LA friend right off the first episode ;)  I still like The Hills though, but I don't take it seriously.  LOL.

So you can't take "reality television" very seriously.  Because honestly, if they did actually have a genuine "reality show", it would be boring.  The demand for reality TV is so high that they have to make "themes" for certain episodes, etc.  For example, Run's House (and for every other show), they have themes (hence its staged for storyline purposes) but they are genuine in terms of how they react and personal issues are true too.



Source(s):



mtvthehills.tk



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thanks and I agree with you 100% !



</asker's comment>

Total points: 173 (Level 1)

<question>



Animal cruelty or art?



What was your reaction to reading the news that the crew at Eastenders had to put down a healthy dog recently to film the 'Wellard death' scene? The Daily Mail seemed to take the view that this was a necessary act to get the mood right for the scene, both for the viewer and also so the child actors crying was realistic. I disagree however and take the view that this was an appalling act of animal cruelty.



</question>



<answer from>



Nancy D
Member since: 16 July 2008
Total points: 705 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



If the children are professional actors, they should be able to cry on cue. You are taught in theater class to think of your saddest memory and you can usually cry right on cue.

Killing a healthy dog is totally unnecessary.



</answer>

<answer>



Well I used to deal in clearance dvds so perhaps I can give a fair estimate. Friends are published by Warner Bros who nearly always over manufacture. This will be a huge seller. However by next year every Friends fan will have bought it, so then you are trying to sell it to people who just want a bargain and are more price concious. If i had to make a guess my estimate would be £50 in the shops next year, possibly £25-£30 on Amazon, Play etc. £20 second hand on Ebay. Certainly don't buy it as an investment



</answer>



<answer from>



annhen
Member since: 19 May 2008
Total points: 258 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



maybe get it in a bargain bin in a video store for £10 now thats a bargain



</answer>

<question from>



The Paige Master
Member since: 03 April 2008
Total points: 159 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Who else hated the Series 4 finale of Doctor Who?



it's the only one that I've ever hated. . . 
I'd just like a general opinion.



</question>



<answer from>



david j
Member since: 21 March 2007
Total points: 3 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



yep crap



</answer>



<answer from>



Avondrow
Member since: 16 July 2006
Total points: 39554 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



It was a curate's egg - good in parts!
Davis crammed too much in. He tried to pull together everything from all his earlier series and the result was a mess. Too many characters having too little time - The whole Rose thing could have been so much better handled.
And the plot itself was just silly
But it had it's moments. The confrontation between Davros and the Dr was excellent. And the fate of Donna was heart-wrenching.
Dr Who fans owe thanks to R T Davis for getting the timelord back on the telly, but it is perhaps a good thing that he is handing over to Moffat, who has written some of the best episodes so far.



</answer>



<answer from>



The LOON)
Member since: 08 October 2007
Total points: 7063 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



If 4 is the one just finished? Well i'm probably 4 episodes from the end and it's been low budget and lack lustre!! This side kick isn't working one bit, she's too hard faced!! That library one is the last i watched and that did my damn head in!!!!!! Tennant is a FANTASTIC Doctor though.. THAT IS ACTING!!



</answer>



<answer from>



Who's your Doctor?
Member since: 09 November 2007
Total points: 8264 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Regarding the Rose storyline, it was a little unsatisfying but otherwise I really enjoyed it.



</answer>



<answer from>



RoseE
Member since: 24 May 2007
Total points: 893 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



NOTE: ****SOME "JOUNEY'S END" SPOILERS!!!*** BELOW!

RTD has never once claimed to be doing Doctor Who for the fans.
It was all about what he thought the Doctor would be like at this point in time, under these circumstances. 
I personally agreed with him that the Doctor should be: 
1. Intimidating (hello -- TIME LORD!)
2. Frightening and Menacing (genocidal/race-ending TIME LORD.)
3. Angry and Bitter (look out enemies of Earth and the Universe!)
4. Alone (Last of his kind. Period.)
It's true he needs individuals; admirers and companions to help and support him, otherwise how could we even hope to relate to the Doctor except through them?



***But, yah... I was disappointed mostly. Donna's loss was just heartbreaking. It somehow made me feel horrible. I didn't mind the Regeneration - thought it was rather innovative.



HOWEVER, then the Doctor goes and gives Rose the Regen10 version of himself. I mean, it made sense... gah!!  I'll reconcile myself someday that it was a good idea - but it still bugs me!***

Everything just felt forced and compressed to me (oh no, feel an analogy coming on...) it was like I was being chased by that snowball rolling down the mountain getting bigger and bigger, crushing everything in its wake... I eventually just jumped out of the way and let it roll past to crash to the bottom, destroying the ski lodge and exploding when it hit the village.

(Some of the members of our DW group are still depressed despite going to ComicCon and listening to Steven Moffatt's DW panel.) It's all about "change", apparently.



</answer>

<question>



Passions ended?!?  I know it wasn't the lowest rated of all the soaps. I'm surprised.?



Can anyone tell me what happened in the end?



</question>



<answer from>



Snowange...
Member since: 02 May 2007
Total points: 124 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



You can actually view full episodes of Passions at http://s9.zetaboards.com/CraneEstate/ind... I don't recall how far back they are posted however, I can tell you for sure the last few weeks are definitely there.

But if you would like to know how it ended I'll give the Reader's Digest Version. Tabitha sacrificed her powers to save the residents of Harmony after they were poisoned by Vincent & Vicky. Four weddings took place over the course of the last 2 weeks as Mount Harmony started to erupt. Gwen & Rebbecca were finally exposed for everything they did to Ethan. Theresa revealed Little Ethan's true paternity. Antonio came back from the dead. Then to save Harmony from the volcano Tabitha had to be baptized. The show ended with one final wedding... Ethan & Theresa.



</answer>

<answer>



Um actually Passions was the lowest rated soap opera. It was very popular among teenagers but of course school was a top priority among other things so the ratings were always low during the school year and even the summer they didn't bother catching up. with so much drama involved within the soap operas if it still interested them. Why it was pulled the plug is way beyond your power. It's an NBC thing. It had a LONG time coming. Just ask all the other NBC soap operas that was on during the 70s, 80s and 90s other than Days of our Lives but even that will soon be given the boot. I'm not surprised because all of their storylines were so wacky...mermaids and witchcraft come on. It can't get any better than this.



</answer>

<answer>



"Passions" was the lowest rated soap opera on TV, but I don't know the real reason why NBC pulled the plug and moved it to DirecTV despite establishing a cult following among younger viewers. And everyone lives happily ever after.

<original file>index;_ylt=AudeOdW2L.fwhHmSc0CIpan8Ohh1b78.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk41230.txt</current file name>



<category>



Entertainment & Music



Television



</category>



<question from>



Ben
Member since: 31 March 2007
Total points: 415 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Why don't they show new episodes



new episodes of the show "cops" in england on FX? just loads of old ones?



</question>



<answer from>



Ivan R
Member since: 09 November 2006
Total points: 18503 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Hello,

(ANS) This is a much wider problem than just the "cops" program your talking about, repeats are a problem with ALL TV companies and TV channels.

**Repeats = cheap or cheaper

**Original TV programs of any kind or original TV programs that are commissioned = expensive.

**and TV series from the USA = extra cheap

**Repeats are a method commonly used by the BBC to fill in large gaps in the daily TV schedule, the worst is Saturday evening (in fact its so bad & TV programs on Saturday evening are frankly appalling I almost stopped watching. Its brain numbingly bad). Its cold comfort to see that even if I had SKY & a 1,000 channels I wouldn't be any better off.

**I think standards have slipped badly what oh!!

Ivan.



</answer>



<answer from>



Helen♥Ch...
Member since: 10 April 2008
Total points: 6581 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Reality Television



</answer from>



<answer>



I don't think they make it any more. The new episodes used to be on terrestrial tv (i think it was on bbc2) but they stopped making it in about 2000



</answer>

<question from>



tbell182...
Member since: 16 June 2008

</question from>



<question>



Why is this show called "All My Children"?



</question>



<answer from>



Scrappy, The Snappy Sneezer
Member since: 26 October 2007
Total points: 2209 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



It is the Brotherhood of Man, we are all God's Children. Creator Agnes Nixon wrote a poem that started the show:

The Great and the Least,

The Rich and the Poor,

The Weak and the Strong,

In Sickness and in Health,

In Joy and Sorrow,

In Tragedy and Triumph,

You are ALL MY CHILDREN



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_My_Chil...



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thank you!!!



</asker's comment>

<answer>



Here is my prediction....Nicole is the winner, mark is the runner up and Craig is the mole...

Here are some reasons why i think that Craig is the mole...

The first online clue was E_E_E_. (ElEvEn)?
-Craig was born in November. He is also the 11th player in the opening.

There was a clue on an advertisement, "I lie with my eyes."
-Craig wears glasses. In some episodes he doesn't...

In the first episode, they ride to the Robinson Crusoe misson on a boat based on Alexander Selkirk. With some research, you find that he was actually born Alexander Sellcraig. ahem

In the opening of every episode from 2 on, Craig is the only one that had the word "Age" in front of his age. Check it out.

The second text clue was: heart
That could mean "earth" which is mentioned in Craig's online profile. 
It could also point to his humanitarian work he's done in the past.

In the pig mission, Craig's team brought back 0 pigs.

When a woman said in Spanish that Bobby should eat something when they had to find their clothes, Craig understood and told him what she said. If he understands Spanish, why didn't he help find pigs in that mission?

In the Fruits of the Luge mission, Craig and Victoria continued going over the order after the finish line. Jon told them on many occasions that was not allowed. This disqualified his team, putting no money into the pot. They got all of them right, which ended up taking $14,000 out with their disqualification.

In week 4, Craig had to be hospitalized after the mountain mission. This left him absent from dinner where Jon took all the journal's and read quotes out of them. (We wouldn't want the mole's journal being read out load now would we?) Craig's journal also doesn't get his journal burned.

In the week 5's mission in the jail, the letters "CRG" has be plainly seen behind Mark in a couple of shots.

In the mission where Craig was selected to order what each person wore, Jon hold's up two bills with the number 5 as he says 5.5 miles.
Craig has 5 letters in his name.

Isn't it strange how Craig happened to say "exemption" to get an exemption?

Craig tried to sabotage the mission on the mission in week 7 multiple times. He tried to mess up Nicole's count, tried to waste time by telling the guys to wait for Nicole to come back with the correct tile count when they were on the birnk of figuring out the pattern of the the code. He gives the wrong answer when Clay asks what 89+144 is. Craig also waits until the very last minute to enter the code in. Lots of moley activity there.

Keep in mind that Craig is the only player that has never been given his results in an execution.

<answer>

But if they aren't, you can allways download the show here 'torrentz.com', you also need 'bitlord' or something to download the torrent. Then you just find English subs on the net, 'opensubtitles.com' for example. Run the vid eith 'VLC', then after extracting the subtitle, you just drag it into VLC-screen. enjoy :)



</answer>

<question from>



bumbleph...
Member since: 19 May 2007
Total points: 436 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



The final Doctor Who..........were you disappointed?



</question>



<additional details>



It's a bit difficult to explain what happened in minor detail!!  You'll have to watch it on line sorry :-)



I've watched it again on iplayer this morning, and it did seem better.  The only concern I would have on Rose's behalf was the Doctor did seem to have some of Donna's character in it........or was he just messing about!!  I had a good blub I have to admit, but I know what Rose meant about it still not being him though.  She was told the doctor she was left with was the doctor she changed, now she's going to have to do it all again!!  I think I'd feel a bit cheated left with a duplicate David Tennant!!!



</additional details>



<answer from>



SolarFla...
Member since: 26 July 2007
Total points: 8276 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Wow!! Wow!! An amazing episode. I loved every moment of it. I thought it was the best one since the finale of season 2 (when Rose first becamed trapped in the parallel universe).

I'm glad I recorded it and watched it on DVD because there were several bits which I needed to rewind & rewatch to figure out, such as how & why the 2nd doctor appeared, the reason for Khan going mad, the reason for Donna becoming half Time Lord. Some things weren't explained properly such as the doctors words to Doctor-Donna "A human Time-Lord metacrisis has never happened." Huh?! Guess it was one of those jargon things you're not meant to make sense of though I usually try to, and sometimes they do make sense!



Unlike some other people, I didn't think that the daleks were destroyed too quickly & easily. It was done with a twist and in a way which tied a lot of loose ends together. I found it gave a sense of completion about a lot of things. The daleks were destroyed because the 2nd doctor built the reality bomb invertor device and pointed it at Davros' DNA. As Davros used his DNA to create the daleks this meant that the destructive power of the dalek's reality bomb was  redirected at dalek DNA instead of away from the dalek's location (the crucible) and toward the whole of the rest of existence. Just at the point at which the invertor was needed there was only Donna available to use it. At that moment Davros shot her with the energy weapon and inadvertantly "switched on" the time lord in her thus giving her the knowledge to use the invertor.



At that point all the comments of the past few episodes about there being something different about Donna, reality bending around her, her destiny with the doctor, all timelines converging on her, were explained. She saved all of reality by operating the reality bomb invertor. It was a perfect!!



I thought Donna needing to forget everything was terribly tragic, but if the writers want to bring Donna back I'm sure they'll find a way.

The one thing that does bug the hell out of me is what the Doctor did to Rose. I think that was a big cop out so that Billie Piper wouldn't have to play a big part in future episodes. If the Doctor had loved her, as we've found out over the episodes that he does, then he would want to be with her as much as she with him. She has spent all this time fighting through dimensional walls and searching for him. Now he's using the excuse that the 2nd doctor is dangerous because he destroyed all of the Daleks (commited genocide which is an abhorrent thing to the Doctor) and so needs to be watched. Why does that mean that Rose HAS to go back to her universe? The 2nd Doctor could have been watched in our universe. He could have been left with Unit; they would have LOVED to have his expertise at close hand. If the Doctor had really wanted to be with Rose then he would have tried harder to find a way. And, the 2nd doctor is NOT the same as the main one because he's half Donna. Big cop out. It's been bugging me ever since I saw the episode.

Except for that - PURE MAGIC. ;-)



</answer>



<asker's comment>



That was my biggest disappointment.  I know I'm a bit girly when it comes to the romance thing, but I couldnt believe the doctor could just leave Rose, as said when she had travelled so far.  It wasnt him it was a clone!!  That was my issue with it, but reading all the answers I agree it was rushed.



</asker's comment>

SolarFla…



Thanks. ;-)

<answer from>



Artemis
Member since: 21 September 2006
Total points: 16751 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Drama



Other - Television



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



I hate to say it but actually, yes, I was.  It was a great episode, very enjoyable to watch, David Tennant was his usual brilliant self and yes it was nice to see all the companions united but.....



it seemed that after all the hype and all the build up to this almighty showdown with Davros and the daleks that it was all over really quickly in the end.



I thought it would take more than a single shot from Jack to destroy the Supreme Dalek and Donna becoming half Timelord, gaining all that power and intellect and destroying the entire dalek fleet by flicking a few switches....... wasn't that just a little too similar to Rose absorbing energy from the TARDIS in 'The Parting of the Ways' and destroying the daleks with a wave of her hand???  The Doctor's solution to getting rid of the daleks and cybermen in 'Doomsday' was much more satisfying.

And speaking of Rose - she got the best deal she could realistically have hoped for - she's in love with the Tenth Doctor and she gets to spend the rest of her life with basically the Tenth Doctor in semi-human form, he won't regenerate and he'll stay with her forever and the woman is STILL POUTING!!!!

Then there was Dalek Caan's prophecy that one of the companions would die.  For the entire season we've had all the not-so-subtle hints about Donna and then there was endless speculation after Dalek Caan's prediction in 'The Stolen Earth' about which companion would die but instead we just get this nice, neat little fairy tale ending?? I really liked Donna and I would have been sad to see her die but for dramatic purposes I think Russell T Davis should have followed through on that particular story line.  Wasn't the ending of 'Last of the Timelords' even more dramatic with the death of the Master? Even though I was surprised and shocked that the Master seemed to be completely dead once and for all - it had a much better dramatic impact and the series finale was all the better for it.

I love Doctor Who, I really do, so I'll watch the finale repeat again tonight and see if maybe I'm being too critical : )



</answer>



<answer from>



Captain Shamrock
Member since: 27 July 2006
Total points: 2185 (Level 3)

<question>



Do commercials actually pay a tv show because I get confuse when people say blah blah is brought to you by...?



so do commercials actually pay the show because what they are doing is actually sponsoring the show, i guess



</question>



<answer from>



brokenar...
Member since: 10 August 2008
Total points: 243 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Yes companies pay lots and lots of money for air time so the millions of people watching will see their commercial.  when, what actually happens is we all go get a drink or go to the bathroom on commercial breaks.



</answer>



<answer from>



JD
Member since: 12 September 2006
Total points: 12285 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



yes, commercials, and the companies who pay for them, are a major part of the revenue of a tv station and what helps them to air their shows.



</answer>

<answer>



Yes, it was changed to help people remember it.



The number used to be : 09011 40 50 60, but even though the "40, 50, 60" was supposed to be easy enough to remember, it was changed to the 09011 123456 so it was more simple for people to remember!

<question from>



tina
Member since: 06 July 2006
Total points: 318 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Did anyone watch Oprah today?



Dr. Oz was on and was telling tips for losing weight. I was just wondering if anyone knows what he said. I looked on Oprah.com, but since they redone the web-site I can't figure it out at all. There was something he said about eating a piece of whole wheat bread before you eat? I don't know. Just wondering if any Oprah viewers caught this or not?



</question>



<answer from>



Dreamly
Member since: 05 October 2007
Total points: 2604 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



here's a link for Dr Oz on Oprah that talks about it 
http://www.oprah.com/slideshow/oprahshow...

here's some of what he says eat one slice of 100 percent whole grain bread lightly dipped in non-chemically processed extra virgin olive oil before every dinner. "[The bread has] B vitamins in it. It has fiber, which we've talked about is important for you," he says. "That's all good because it actually slows the movement of food through your stomach."



The olive oil, Dr. Oz says, is a healthy fat. "Remember, healthy fats are the ones that are liquid at room temperature in general, and olive oil has vitamin E in it," Dr. Oz says. "It's got all these cool little chemicals that work as antioxidants. If you combine them together, you're giving yourself wonderful nutrition to feed the liver."



Dr. Oz says this easy, yet powerful, combination will reduce the amount of food you'll eat at dinner and keep your fuller for longer amounts of time. "Dinner's our big meal where we make most of our mistakes," he says. These mistakes can lead to serious consequences, like heart attack or diabetes. Eating whole wheat bread and olive oil can reduce your risk for both, Dr. Oz says. "And you'll probably lose weight to boot."



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Thank you so much, this is just what I needed!!!



</asker's comment>

<answer>



Elvis Presley's first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show and the "Lucy Goes to the Hospital" episode of I Love Lucy hold the record as the highest rated telecasts of all time.



Source(s):



www.wikipedia.com



</answer>



<answer from>



braby200...
Member since: 17 September 2008
Total points: 93 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



The M*A*S*H series finale, which aired February 28, 1983, entitled "Goodbye, Farewell and Amen" is the most-watched television show in American broadcast history. 50.15 million households (60.2% of those watching TV at the time) tuned into the episode on CBS.



</answer>

<question>



The Maury Show... Fake?



Okay so I know that a lot of people think this show is fake, but I always thought it was real.  That was until I saw this guy on Maury.  He was on the show about 4 times becuase he cheated on his wife.  Each time, he cried and cried and said he wanted his wife and he was so sorry.

THEN I saw the same guy on the Jerry Springer show, and he said the same thing... he was cheating on his wife.  But this time, he didn't care what she said, and he was being just a bastard.  Totally opposite from the Maury Show.

I now KNOW that Maury is fake (I already knew Jerry was fake lol)... what do you all think about this?  Do you believe it's fake as well?



</question>



<answer from>



Acidblon...
Member since: 07 July 2008
Total points: 609 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Fake. I do think most of the shows on TV are fake or have a strong element of fakery, including the so-called 'unscripted' ones. The bottom line is that the people who produce these TV shows want to make money, and they are not going to put 'reality' on TV because it could be boring and nobody would watch. Whether there's a script or just some person telling the reality stars to create drama, I think it's manufactured.
But good for you for having a critical eye and noticing at least! I think fewer and fewer people notice anymore, lol...
I'll admit to ocassionally still looking at those fakeass shows though for a laugh every now and again though~ ;)



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Exactlly.



</asker's comment>

<original file>index;_ylt=Aq132uPEunjhs.cO8036P_8gBgx9a3a.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk46624.txt</current file name>



<category>



Entertainment & Music



Television



</category>



<question from>



Heldor
Member since: 24 August 2007
Total points: 852 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



Script for the full exorcism used in show Supernatural?



Some friends and I thought it'd be cool to learn the exorcism used in the show Supernatural, and so I'm wondering if anyone knows all the words/could link me to a site with it?



</question>



<answer from>



Artemis
Member since: 21 September 2006
Total points: 16751 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Drama



Other - Television



Movies



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Voters</evaluation>



The most detailed exorcisms we've seen used in Supernatural so far are the ones that Sam uses in the season 3 episode 'Jus in Bello' - there were three exorcisms used in that episode:

Exorcizamus te, omnis immundus spiritus, omnis satanica potestas, omnis incursio infernalis adversarii, omnis legio, omnis congregatio et secta diabolica
(This was the first exorcism)

Exorcizamus te, omnis immundus spiritus, omnis satanica potestas, omnis incursio infernalis adversarii, omnis legio, et secta diabolica,
Ergo draco maledicte et sectio
Ergo draco maledicte et legio secta diabolica
Ut Ecclésiam tuam secúra tibi fácias servire libertáte, te rogámus, audi nos.
(This was the exorcism for Agent Henrickson)

Exorcizamus te, omnis immundus spiritus, omnis satanica potestas, omnis incursio infernalis adversarii, omnis legio, omnis congregatio et secta diabolica

Ergo, draco maledicte et omnis legio diabolica, adjuramus te,
cessa decipere humanas creaturas, eisque æternæ perditionìs venenum propinare
Vade, satana, inventor et magister omnis fallaciæ, hostis humanæ salutis,
Humiliare sub potenti manu Dei, contremisce et effuge, invocato a nobis sancto et terribili Nomini
quem inferi tremunt
Ab insidiis diaboli, libera nos, Domine.

Exorcizamus te, omnis immundus spiritus, omnis satanica potestas, omnis incursio infernalis adversarii, omnis legio, omnis congregatio et secta diabolica

Ergo, draco maledicte et omnis legio diabolica, adjuramus te ... cessa decipere humanas creaturas, eisque æternæ perditionìs venenum propinare

Ut Ecclesiam tuam secura tibi facias libertate servire, te rogamus, audi nos.
(This is from the mass exorcism at the end)

Here is the official English translation of a Rite of Exorcism - though I don't think the full exorcism was used in Supernatural only bits of it:

I cast you out, unclean spirit, along with every Satanic power of the enemy, every spectre from hell, and all your fell companions; in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Begone and stay far from this creature of God. For it is He who commands you, He who flung you headlong from the heights of heaven into the depths of hell. It is He who commands you, He who once stilled the sea and the wind and the storm. Hearken, therefore, and tremble in fear, Satan, you enemy of the faith, you foe of the human race, you begetter of death, you robber of life, you corrupter of justice, you root of all evil and vice; seducer of men, betrayer of the nations, instigator of envy, font of avarice, fomentor of discord, author of pain and sorrow. Why, then, do you stand and resist, knowing as you must that Christ the Lord brings your plans to nothing? Fear Him, who in Isaac was offered in sacrifice, in Joseph sold into bondage, slain as the paschal lamb, crucified as man, yet triumphed over the powers of hell. Begone, then, in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Give place to the Holy Spirit by this sign of the holy cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, who lives and reigns with the Father and the Holy Spirit, God, forever and ever.

Therefore, I adjure you every unclean spirit, every spectre from hell, every satanic power, in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, who was led into the desert after His baptism by John to vanquish you in your citadel, to cease your assaults against the creature whom He has, formed from the slime of the earth for His own honor and glory; to quail before wretched man, seeing in him the image of almighty God, rather than his state of human frailty. Yield then to God, who by His servant, Moses, cast you and your malice, in the person of Pharaoh and his army, into the depths of the sea. Yield to God, who, by the singing of holy canticles on the part of David, His faithful servant, banished you from the heart of King Saul. Yield to God, who condemned you in the person of Judas Iscariot, the traitor. For He now flails you with His divine scourges, He in whose sight you and your legions once cried out: "What have we to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? Have you come to torture us before the time?" Now He is driving you back into the everlasting fire, He who at the end of time will say to the wicked: "Depart from me, you accursed, into the everlasting fire which has been prepared for the devil and his angels." For you, 0 evil one, and for your followers there will be worms that never die. An unquenchable fire stands ready for you and for your minions, you prince of accursed murderers, father of lechery, instigator of sacrileges, model of vileness, promoter of heresies, inventor of every obscenity.

Depart, then, impious one, depart, accursed one, depart with all your deceits, for God has willed that man should be His temple. Why do you still linger here? Give honor to God the Father almighty, before whom every knee must bow. Give place to the Lord Jesus Christ, who shed His most precious blood for man. Give place to the Holy Spirit, who by His blessed apostle Peter open



Source(s):



http://www.catholicdoors.com/prayers/eng...
http://supernaturalfanwiki.wetpaint.com/...



s



</answer>

<question>



What do the expression heard on tonite eastenders mean?



'going nuclear' calum text it bk 2 his dad wen he asked how it was going

then tanya sed something about jack 2 max and he replied sayin 'bully for him'



</question>



<answer from>



Philip H ®
Member since: 17 July 2008
Total points: 1254 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Bully for him - Good for him



Going Nuclear - Meltdown



</answer>



<answer from>



pynkbyrd
Member since: 07 July 2006
Total points: 8675 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Other - Food & Drink



</answer from>



<answer>



Going nuclear can either mean something really hot, as in a nuclear bomb; that is, explosive, or "cool" as in "the bomb" meaning good.

"Bully for him" means "Good for him." It could be meant positively or sarcastically.  It's not all that popular a saying these days.



</answer>



<answer from>



Laurz_2k...
Member since: 11 March 2008

Going nuclear can either mean something really hot, as in a nuclear bomb; that is, explosive, or "cool" as in "the bomb" meaning good.

"Bully for him" means "Good for him." It could be meant positively or sarcastically. It's not all that popular a saying these days.

<answer from>



Eddy_09
Member since: 30 July 2008
Total points: 3024 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Reality Television



Soap Operas



</answer from>



<answer>



Once alone, Jared worries that Natalie is still angry with him, as she's not answering her cell. Although Jared knows she'll be even unhappier to hear that Ray is a murderer, Clint admits that he didn't think Jared could pull it off, leaving Jared to hope it'll all be worth it in the end. While Ray is getting ready, Nigel briefly asks Clint if he should secure the silver, to which Jared reminds, "Clint, I hope you know you asked me to spring a 'lifer'." Suddenly, Ray appears all cleaned up, and Clint doesn't see a need to wait any longer! Clint asks Nigel to show Ray to his limo then says, "Jared, you did good. You're one step closer to making up for what you did to this family." However, Jared can't get Natalie out of his head and leaves for Llanfair
Down in the secret room, Tess brings Natalie some food then says, "I need you to keep up your strength because we have work to do." Though Natalie warns that Jared will wonder where she is, Tess says, "You are going to write Jared a 'Dear John' letter, telling him all of the reasons why you left him!" After Tess reads Natalie the letter she plans to send to Jared, explaining that they've caused too much damage to others to live in happiness themselves, she demands that Natalie copy the letter - or Jared dies! In tears, Natalie is forced to do what Tess asks. Once the letter is written in Natalie's handwriting, Tess points to the television screen and says, "Enjoy the show!"



With Tess now upstairs, joining Tina, Sarah and Jared, Tess explains that she hasn't seen Natalie - but that she found a letter for him in her room! Tess hands Jared the letter, as Natalie watches helpless! As Jared reads the goodbye letter from Natalie, Tina makes eye contact with Tess, who says, "Jared, I am so sorry." Downstairs, Natalie cries, "I love you, Jared… I love you."
When Natalie wakes up in the secret room, she sees Jared standing outside the glass, who tells her, "I love her more than I could ever imagine." Suddenly, Natalie wakes up and realizes she was hearing Jared through the television, telling Tess how much he loves Natalie. Natalie rushes to the screen and says, "Tess, what the hell are you trying to do to us?"



Upstairs, Tess tries to comfort Jared, who has had no luck finding Natalie. "It's like she vanished off the face of the earth," Jared says, to which Tess believes her absence means she doesn't want to be found. Jared refuses to believe that Natalie is hiding from him and says, "Something else is going on here." Frustrated, Jared leaves.



Back in the basement, Natalie begins tearing the room apart - until Tess shows up with Jared's uneaten breakfast. "Here we go," Tess says. "Breakfast of losers!" Though Natalie warns Tess that Jared will not give up on her, and begs for Jessica to come out, Tess says, "Why do I bother going through all this trouble when I should just kill you right now!" Tess then lays out her new plan - to have Natalie be tortured by having to 'watch' Jared move on! "You get to watch Jared fall out of love with you," Tess says, "and in love with me!"



When Jared arrives at the station, he informs John, "It's about Natalie. I think she's been kidnapped!" After John asks Jared some common 'police questions', and reads the letter Natalie left Jared, John suggests that Natalie is not missing - but that she merely broke up with him! However, when Jared asks John to read the letter again, John agrees it's not Natalie's style and says he'll look into it.



Rex and Gigi Have Sex!  Gigi and Rex take time out to consummate their reunion this week.  Gigi leaves the carriage house pissed off because Brody is starting to get psychotic, so she tells him that when she gets back she wants him and all his stuff gone.  Gigi goes to share the news with Rex, who has just called Adriana to request a divorce.  Gigi comes in and says that they are going to tell Shane the truth that day.  Gigi wishes they had some time to celebrate finding each other again.  Rex says that Shane doesn’t get out of school for a few hours and they start kissing.  One thing leads to another, and Gigi finally has sex after 10 years.



Rex and Gigi Make Love!  Gigi and Rex have something important to share with Shane this week, but first they finally make love.  They make love in Adriana’s bed.  Rex and Gigi talk about going to Shane’s school and telling Shane that Rex is his dad, but there is time to spare so they spend a couple of hours making love.  After romantic bouts in the bed and in the shower, the couple goes into parent mode.  Rex dresses in his most appropriate fatherlike outfit.  Gigi and Rex’s trip to school turns out to be a new dad’s worst nightmare.



</answer>

<answer from>



joefuls
Member since: 13 April 2008
Total points: 988 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



The Simpsons is the best show ever.. I hear a lot of people say family guy is better than the simpsons, but come on.. they've been around since 1987.. they've been around before a majority of the family guy viewers have been born.. and they're still going strong.



Family Guy is ok, but will never compare to The Simpsons.. prove me wrong with facts.



Besides giving me a thumbs down, support your opinion if you think Family Guy is better



The Simpsons has won dozens of awards since it debuted as a series, including 24 Emmy Awards, 26 Annie Awards and a Peabody Award. Time magazine's December 31, 1999 issue named it the 20th century's best television series, and on January 14, 2000 it was awarded a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The Simpsons is the longest-running American sitcom and the longest-running American animated program. Homer's annoyed grunt "D'oh!" has been adopted into the English lexicon, while The Simpsons has influenced many adult-oriented animated sitcoms.



Family guy was canceled.. twice



Family Guy and its cast have been nominated for 8 Emmy Awards, with three wins:
The show has also been nominated for ten Annies, and won three times, twice in 2006 and once in 2008. The show has also been nominated for a Golden Reel Award three times, winning once



</answer>



<answer from>



budlowsb...
Member since: 05 July 2006
Total points: 3704 (Level 4)



</answer from>

<question>



Asian drama suggestions? romance comedy?

japanese:
1. zettai kareshi
2. hana yori dango
3. hotaru no hikari
4. kimi wa petto*



tawainese:
1. peachgirl
2. love contract
3. devil beside you*
4. why why love
5. meteor garden



and i have tried to watch but did not like: hana kimi, it started with a kiss, itazura na kiss, maramalade boy, romantic princess, tokyo juliet mars or smiling pasta. anyways please and thankiess



</question>



<additional details>



btw i don't mind korean dramas either, but i prefer japanese or tawainese..



haha like i said i don't mind korean dramas at all



</additional details>



<answer from>



teehee!
Member since: 05 May 2008
Total points: 2996 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Couple or Trouble (Korean Drama) is my favorite!



Source(s):



http://www.mysoju.com/couple-or-trouble/



</answer>



<asker's comment>



seems the most interesting.. thanks!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Phineas
Member since: 03 January 2008
Total points: 18069 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



You might not like Korean dramas, but they are the best in the asian market in both Drama and romantic comedy. I have a good recommendation for a Korean drama movie, but you need to open your mind outside of your style. Have you seen Sil Mi Do? it's a true story about a secret special forces unit that was composed of South Korean prisoners who were supposed to be put to death. The South Koreans instead decided to train them to kill Kim, Il Sung. It's really not a war movie, it's more of a drama. As for Korean romantic comedy, the best is "My Sassy Girl". It's right up your alley, but I forgot the translation so I wrote it in English.



BTW I am not Korean, so do not think I am being biased. Just trying to help.



</answer>



<answer from>



Gabriela R
Member since: 22 June 2008
Total points: 197 (Level 1)



</answer from>

<answer from>



Spacepha...
Member since: 13 February 2007
Total points: 27660 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



I'm was certainly sad about it when i first heard this morning, not to mention very surprised. It was quite a shock when i saw it announced on BBC Breakfast this morning. I was certain that Tennant would do one more series, and everything seemed to be pointing to that.



He has obviously decided to move on though, and we fans should do the same. As I've said many times before, Doctor Who has always thrived on change. Actors come and go, and the Doctor's appearance and surface personality changes from time to time, but his character and core values endure, as does the series itself. The phenomenon that is Doctor Who is bigger than any single actor.



The last of the 2009 specials will now be the end of an era in more ways than one, with both Tennant and Russel. T Davies leaving at the same time. Tennant is one of this countries finest actors, if not the finest, and has given some of the best performances as the Doctor in the history of the series. I'm sure his career will go from success to success. RTD has brought Doctor Who back from the dead and made it into the huge success it is today. We fans owe both of them a huge debt of gratitude.



So although I'm sad that Tennant has decided not to continue, I'm also excited to find out what comes next.



The Christmas special titled "The Next Doctor" is going to be very interesting. In addition to David Tennant, it features David Morrisey who also plays a character called "The Doctor". Could this be our introduction to the 11th Doctor, just a few episodes before the regeneration takes place? The Timing of David Tennant's announcement suggests it might be. If not, why didn't Tennant wait until nearer the time before announcing that he was leaving?



</answer>



<answer from>



Bgirl
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 102 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Horrible!!! It seems its too early....



</answer>



<answer from>



Ashley M
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 100 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Im alright because im not a big fan of it!



But it is quite sad because he was my favourite doctor!



</answer>

<question>



So do you think Lisa (Cuddy) and (Gregory) House on House M.D. are going to be a "pair" now?



last night's episode, they were like making out, so do you think that will lead to more???



</question>



<answer from>



eithne03...
Member since: 25 October 2007
Total points: 337 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



Hm, that's a hard question. Because it is was real life, they probably would. It's been building up for a while, what with all that tension where they pretend to hate each other but actually like each other.



Unfortunately, it is in TV Land, and in TV Land, writers love to keep us on the edge of our seats by dangling really obvious things in front of us and then taking them away at the last second (or dragging something out for a few seasons). So no, I don't think that they are going to be a 'pair'... or if they are, something unexpected is going to pop up and ruin everything. It's not going to be as easy as 'hey, let's get together' 'okay!'.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



thnx people!



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



ZER0 C00L •AM• •VT• •student•
Member since: 18 August 2006
Total points: 133347 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Drama



Religion & Spirituality



</answer from>



<answer>



*chuckle*  No, absolutely not.  There's going to be a lot of awkwardness, they may sleep together a few times, but they're certainly not going to be a "couple".  Cuddy can't take all of House's crap with a smile and a roll of her eyes.  She gets way too pissed at him all the time.  There may be a physical attraction (in fact, we all know that there IS a physical attraction at this point) but there's no real romantic future for them.



</answer>

<question from>



JellyCat
Member since: 17 July 2006
Total points: 3060 (Level 4)



</question from>



<question>



Desperate housewives question about Orson? (spoilers)?



I have been watching it faithfully lately and only up to begining season 3. I also watched the new episodes this past week. I'm rather curious about Orson and his ex-wife that was possibly killed by him and I noticed he went to prison.



What happened with his exwife?



Why did he go to prison? (from this past week, on the 5 year recap)



I just have to know, I'm hooked!



</question>



<answer from>



Rose D
Member since: 08 July 2006
Total points: 37746 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Drama



Other - Television



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



His ex-wife wasn't dead, she just kinda faked it.  She and Orson's mother were in league - Orson was in love with another woman and wanted a divorce.  His mother killed his girlfriend and he felt obligated to try to protect her.  This is why he ran down Mike - Mike knew the victim and saw Orson at her house the night of the murder.  He eventually confessed and Mike forgave him, but Bree made him turn himself into the authorities and do prison time to pay for his crime.  As for his ex-wife, she tried to get him back and almost killed Bree before dying in an accident.  Both his mother and ex-wife were crazy.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Neat :) Can't wait to see it! :)



</asker's comment>

<question from>

<question>



Soap watchers, how do you?

</question>



<answer from>

Member since: 25 June 2006
Total points: 7839 (Level 5)



</answer from>

</answer>



<answer from>



RED
Member since: 20 January 2006
Total points: 6460 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Yup, I bring out my laundry basket and fold while I watch, I do the dishes or run the vacuum during the half hour break ( the longest).  My daughter brings out her toys and we play legos or Barbie (the two days she is not in preschool) of course many times I have to change it for 'adult' scenes.



</answer>



<answer from>



Chantal...
Member since: 09 December 2006
Total points: 3925 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



I tivo them so they're always waiting for me when I get home from work. I usually try to watch right when I get home and while Im making dinner. Sometimes I'll try to multi-task and knit or scrapbook at the same time, but my favorite way to watch is after my husband leaves for work I put on my pjs and snuggle in bed and watch. :)



Good question. :)



</answer>

<question>



WHY DOES AIDAN WANT TO DIVORSE GREENLEE?



I DO NOT GET IT. GREENLEE FORGAVE AIDAN FOR SLEEPING WITH HER BEST FRIEND KENDELL. GREENLEE DIDNT DO ANY THING WRONG SO MY QUESTION IS WHY DO THEY GO TO DIVORSE COURT THAN. THEY CANT WORK IT OUT. PLEASE O NEED ANSWERS.  JUST LUV AILEE THEY ARE PERFECT FOR EACH OTHER.

<answer from>



MICHAEL
Member since: 19 February 2008
Total points: 7017 (Level 5)



</answer from>



<answer>



Let's just focus on the crux of things, for simplicity's sake.  If it were just as simple as Greenlee sleeping with Ryan and thereby committing adultery, perhaps Aidan could get past that.  The problem is here Aidan realized that what is in Greenlee's heart is love for Ryan and love for only Ryan and love in a form that goes much, much deeper than any love she has ever felt for or shared with Aidan.  Most males don't want to be in marriages where they are essentially made to feel as if they are a female's consolation prize for not getting the one she really has very deep feelings of love for.  Then, it certainly did not help matters any when Aidan discovered Ryan and Greenlee literally shacking up when the pair were holed up in a shack during the twister storm.



</answer>

<original file>479.html</original file>

<category>



Entertainment & Music



Television



</category>



<question from>



monkeyma...
Member since: 21 March 2006
Total points: 30313 (Level 7)



</question from>



<question>



Should he like to have a hat like that? (doctor who question)?



When Patrick Troughton played the Doctor (on BBC tv's Doctor Who) in the early stories the Doctor was obsessed with hats "I should like a hat like that!". Do you think the continuation of this trait troughout the Second Doctor's tenure would have enhanced the show or detracted from it?



</question>



<answer from>



sosgez
Member since: 11 October 2006
Total points: 23468 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Its just one of his eccentric facets. But yes it would be nice to revisit things like that.



</answer>



<answer from>



Spacepha...
Member since: 13 February 2007
Total points: 27442 (Level 7)



</answer from>



<answer>



To be honest it was a bit of a turn off for me when first saw the second Doctors hat. The second Doctor was eccentric and whimsical enough compared too the first Doctor, and the hat thing was taking it a bit too far in my opinion. Perhaps if the hat had been a bit more sensible, my opinion would have been different. Something more similar to  4th, 5th or 7th Doctors hats perhaps. That silly looking stove pipe was just a bit too much for my liking though. So when he left the hat behind in "The Underwater Menace" it came as a relief for me.



I tend to think that one of the reasons they decided to ditch the idea of the hat was the big dip in ratings after the first regeneration.



The production team at the time realised they had to try and reduce the culture shock a bit for regular viewers, so they got rid of the hat in order to minimise the change of image.



Unfortunately it didn't work that well though. The ratings during the second Doctor's tenure never fully recovered to the levels of viewing figures the first Doctor got, and it wasn't until series 7 with Jon Pertwee as the 3rd Doctor,  that the viewing figures for the first Doctor stories were matched and even surpassed.



</answer>

Sarah B, Canadian Girl

<question>



On House, why did Wilson come back. I thought that he left?



I watched when Wilson left because he was no longer going to enable House's behavior and said that they perhaps were never friends to begin with. I missed a few shows and now he is back, working at the hospital again. What happened and why is he back?



</question>



<answer from>



Hamish
Member since: 11 September 2006
Total points: 138114 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Reality Television



Drama



Other - Television



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



House`s Father died and he wasn`t going to go to the funeral.  His Mother contacted Wilson and asked him to get House to go.  They went in one of the best episodes of House ever.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Birthmarks



Here is the closing dialogue.



Wilson: I spoke with Cuddy. She hasn’t filled my position yet.



House: If you’re coming back just because you’re attracted to the shine of my neediness… I’d be okay with that.



Wilson: I’m coming back because you’re right. That strange, annoying trip we just took was the most fun I’ve had since Amber died.



House: You hungry?



[Wilson nods. House gets up from his desk, and they start to move towards the door.]



House: Wilson?



Wilson: Yeah?



House: My dad’s dead.



Wilson: Yeah. My sympathies.



[House walks through the door. Wilson turns off the light and closes the door, and they start to walk down the hallway together.]



</answer>

Spoiler Alert



When House's father died, Wilson kidnapped him and forced him to go to the funeral. By the end of the trip he basically realized that he missed House, and so he asked Dr. Cuddy if he could have his job back.

Brain Drain. Season 4.



The Source kidnaps Piper and puts this alternate reality in her comatose mind where the Halliwell Manor is in fact a psych ward and herself, Phoebe & Paige are patients. Cole is also there, kept upstairs in heavy restraints. Phoebe runs around with a broom and has a 'Book Of Shadows' which is a notebook with crayon drawings. Paige keeps going on about how Piper hates her because she's not Prue etc. Piper ends up getting hit by a car and nearly gives up her powers but the real Phoebe and Paige intervene into the alternate reality and stop her before it's too late.



Hiphugger.

<question>



In canada where can i watch episodes of survivor?

<answer>



Go to



http://www.2itnow.com/survivor



Make sure you type it in correctly, otherwise it will direct you to another site.  At 2itnow, you have to sign up, but they don't send any spam or junkmail.  It's just a way to keep the show private.



I live in Austria (but I'm an American) and that's where I watch Survivor.



Enjoy!



</answer>

<category>
