<question from>



i see u
Member since: 06 November 2007
Total points: 7963 (Level 5)



</question from>



<question>



Who waited for 'house' to come on-wait a hour for a 2 sec kiss? i thought there was gonna b more!?

OH - but I was happy to see Ryan lose because he took the key of Kelly Anne who actually deserved to win her key.  He could have shaken things up by taking a key from someone in the alliance and took the coward's way out by taking Kelly Anne's key.  So I thought it was fair that he lost.

<original file>15208.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk89093.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Television



</category>



<question from>



Susan H
Member since: 20 May 2008
Total points: 1087 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



Dancing With the Stars Fans?



Who is your favorite professional dancer on the show?



</question>



<answer from>



Mandi
Member since: 09 March 2007
Total points: 139 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



OMG THAT IS SUCH A TOUGH QUESTION!!! I AM AN ABSOLUTE OBSESSED FAN!!!



I love them all but if I did have to pick one it would be Maksim Chmerkovskiy!!! I think he is absolutely gorgeous and his choreography is amazing every week. It seems to me that his partner always learns a lot and usually does pretty well on the show. I also like what he does for the sport (yes it is a sport) of ballroom outside of the show. He is a great advocate for kids around the country and tries to steer them in the right direction through discipline, guidance, and example. Although he is famous, he does not get a big head about it and still enjoys helping out in the community and I really admire that.



I also absolutely love Mark Ballas, Derek Hough, and Julianne Hough. All of them are amazing dancers and creative choreographers. They have fun with their partners and it really shows on the dance floor. I guess the similarities are to be expected though since they all grew up in England together!!! :)



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Excellent answer



</asker's comment>



<answer from>



Am*
Member since: 14 October 2008
Total points: 467 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>

mab7689

</answer from>



<answer>



in the 1st season he doesn't seem to have an ability. he kills a man with telekinesis and finds a way to acquire it and then kills others with abilities by using his telekinesis to scalp them and somehow acquire their ability. however in season 3 it is said that the scalping and acquisition of other abilities IS his ability (and peter has acquired it). this doesn't seem compatible and its confusing as the plots are contradicting each other



</answer>



<answer from>



roo2
Member since: 20 March 2006
Total points: 24321 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Drama



</answer from>



<answer>



His original ability is called intuitive aptitude.  It allows him to look at and instantly understand complex systems, like watches and brains.  He can also look at the brain of someone who has powers and then rewire his own to match.  His ability has a side effect - an obsessive need for more information and to understand, kind of an addiction.  Due to his underlying mental and emotional issues, it's taken the form of an obsession with gaining more and more powers, although this could change given time and therapy.



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intuitive_a...



</answer>



<answer from>



EmilyAVA
Member since: 29 September 2007
Total points: 2539 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Celebrities



</answer from>



<answer>



eating brains for abilities and also he has Claire's ability regenerate



</answer>

<answer>



I think it will almost certainly be David Morrissey.



This year's Christmas episode "The Next Doctor", certainly seems like a great opportunity to introduce the 11th Doctor before Tennant leaves the role, and Steven Moffat will certainly be glad of a familiar face to smooth the transition into his series in 2010. So I think David Morrissey will be the 11th Doctor.



I read a rumour some time ago (can't remember where now) that the 10th Doctor will be quite a bit older in the 2009 specials, and many years will have passed since he left Donna. That could be true now. The 2009 specials will certainly be leading up to the 10th Doctor's regeneration in the last one (probably to be shown on New Years day 2010).



So I think the likelihood is that David Morrissey really will be the next Doctor.



I was saddened by the news that Tennant is leaving, but I'm also excited to find out what happens next. Roll on Christmas!



</answer>

<answer>



There is no way that those guys would have chosen Paula or Johanna over a guy.  They wanted the money, and the only people they were loyal to were each other, and even that only went so far.  I would have loved if Evelyn would have chosen Johnny's key, but, I'm not sure how that would have left things with who she would have ended up with on a boat.  Kenny and Derrick would have had Dunbar and then probably Paula, thinking that they could carry her and that she wouldn't hold them back.



Given that, I think it was the only decision that Evelyn could make considering her choices of who she could end up with in a boat.  If she had taken anyone else's key from the other boat, there still would have been the 4 guys and they would have gone together.  The only way that she could assure that she would be on a winning boat was to take one of those guys out.  And Derrick and Dunbar didn't seem like they banded together to sell out Kenny or Johnny.



So no, Ev isn't a traitor. She was a competitor and did what she needed to win the money.  Paula was a fool who stood by everything that Kenny and Johnny did, and she should not have been surprised about how things ended up.  She was never a strong female competitor.  Ev has always been superior and the guys wanted to win.



</answer>

<question>



Why on that TV show Californication, does the Dad and his daughter keep exchanging that dollar?



From time to time. It could be a twenty....I don't know...I just missed the first season and have noticed that they pass it back and forth...I don't even know if it's the same bill. Just curious....Thanks!...Is he also doing his ex-wifes current husbands daughter?  I don't get to see the show all the time, but that's what I think I've noticed...



</question>



</answer from>



<answer>



The Ex-Wife ended up skipping out on her fiance and going back to Hank. Hank asked her to marry him, and she said no, so Hank moved out. The Ex-Wife and daughter lives in Hanks old place. Hank did have relations with his ex-wifes fiances daughter.

sui



</answer>

<question from>



Thomas
Member since: 15 November 2007
Total points: 136 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



Was the female patient in the TV show "House 4x10" a prostitute?



Hi



In my area (Europe) the TV show "House" was aired with episode 4x10 "It's a wonderful lie" just a couple of days ago. Ever since then me and a couple of other people are thinking very hard about the female patient.



By what House said during his checks we think that he thought she was a prostitute having intercourse with a mule. Although he was pretty blunt about it the female person didn't deny or admit it. What's even stranger is the final scene of that episode where she is playing Jesus' mother riding a mule in what looked like a church play.



So it could very well be that she was just a normal woman who happened to be allergic against mules rather than a prostitute with a knack for animals. But this question was not answered sufficiently within the episode.



Does anyone here know what she was supposed to be?



Thanks!



</question>



<answer from>



Jim Nasium
Member since: 12 October 2008
Total points: 713 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



I think the ending was subtle, but sufficient.
She was vague and evasive in Answering house's questions,
in an effort to get him to come to the production.
You are correct, in that she was an actress portraying Jesus' mother,
Taking place in a church.  Sometimes, during Christmas, Some churches will do this, as the story is age old and still relatively compelling.
Did you notice, when she visited House at the hospital for diagnosis, she was wearing a Medal of St. Jude?  House knows that St. Jude is the patron saint of prostitutes, and she tells him that St. Jude is also the patron saint of lost causes and children. Hope this helps.
EDIT:  Thank you Hamish.  I was going from memory and typing furiously, forgetting the saint's name and I thought st. Jude would be a good cover all.  Busted!



</answer>



<answer from>



Hamish
Member since: 11 September 2006
Total points: 140376 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Reality Television



Drama



Other - Television



</answer from>



<answer>



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It%27s_a_Wo...



I think that House thought that she was a prostitute but I`m sure she wasn`t.  The necklace was of St Nicholas not St. Jude.



Saint Nicholas is also the Saint of the falsely accused, along with prostitutes, and children, making the ending scene of this episode all the more appropriate.



</answer>



<answer from>



bronz_lo...
Member since: 28 May 2008
Total points: 1469 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



She was not a prostitute. She played coy because it was entertaining for her to have House think those things of her. Her ailment was caused by contact with a mule, which she was in contact with during her church's reenactment of Christ's birth.



</answer>

<answer>



in the 1st season he doesn't seem to have an ability. he kills a man with telekinesis and finds a way to acquire it and then kills others with abilities by using his telekinesis to scalp them and somehow acquire their ability. however in season 3 it is said that the scalping and acquisition of other abilities IS his ability (and peter has acquired it). this doesn't seem compatible and its confusing as the plots are contradicting each other

<answer from>



roo2
Member since: 20 March 2006
Total points: 24374 (Level 6)



Contributing In:



Drama



</answer from>



<answer>



His original ability is called intuitive aptitude.  It allows him to look at and instantly understand complex systems, like watches and brains.  He can also look at the brain of someone who has powers and then rewire his own to match.  His ability has a side effect - an obsessive need for more information and to understand, kind of an addiction.  Due to his underlying mental and emotional issues, it's taken the form of an obsession with gaining more and more powers, although this could change given time and therapy.



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intuitive_a...



</answer>



<answer from>



Dylan B
Member since: 27 October 2008
Total points: 153 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



He takes the blood from the other heroes Peter Petrelli can absorb powers by getting by them.



Source(s):



Heroes



</answer>



<answer from>



HipHopGr...
Member since: 05 April 2006
Total points: 18860 (Level 6)



</answer from>



<answer>



Sylar's main ability is "seeing how things work".  His adoptive father was a watch repairment, and he took over the business after his father died. He was good at it because he was able to "see how things work". After 2 seasons of people wondering why he cut people's skulls open to copy their powers, we learned when he copied Clare's regenerative power that he cuts open the skull and looks at the brains. Somehow, he has the ability to see how the brain functions and then copy that ability.



</answer>



<answer from>



Casey L
Member since: 19 September 2008
Total points: 111 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Sylar's ability is called intuitive aptitude. That means he can understand the structure and operation of complex systems without special education or training. That includes people and their abilities. He usually has to look at the brain or the person to understand how peoples' abilities work. He also found ways to absorb others abilities that way. There is also a hunger to know and understand more that comes with the ability.



Source(s):



www.heroes-wiki.com



</answer>

<original file>828.html</original file>

<current file name>yqa_uk97523.txt</current file name>




<category>



Entertainment & Music



Television



</category>



<question from>



xpushpin
Member since: 13 April 2008
Total points: 292 (Level 2)



</question from>



<question>



In season two of Supernatural, when does Sam become posessed by a demon?



Just wondering :) Cheers.



</question>



<answer from>



supernatural crazy
Member since: 29 July 2008
Total points: 3572 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Drama



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



the episode was "born under a bad sign"



Sam goes missing for over a week, and when he finally calls from a motel in Twin Lakes, Iowa, Dean finds him covered in blood, with no memory of what happened. they trace Sam's path back to hunter Steve Wandel's house. they find the hunter dead... and they watch a security video that shows Sam slitting his throat.
Dean destroys the evidence and blames a shapeshifter, but Sam tells him he has been having feelings of uncontrollable rage and implores Dean to kill him. Dean refuses, saying he'd rather die - so Sam cold cocks him!
Sam tracks Jo down to a waterside bar in Duluth, Minnesota. he almost sexually assaults her before tying her to a pillar. Sam tortures Jo with a knife and tells her his father put a bullet in her fathers head. Dean bursts in, gun ready, and Sam begs his brother to shoot him. instead, Dean splashes him with holy water, exposing black demon eyes. Demon-Sam flees to the end of the wharf, then shoots Dean, who falls into the water and doesn't surface.
Demon-Sam goes to Bobby's, intending to kill the hunter, but Bobby tricks him into drinking holy water, then ties him up under a devil's trap. Dean arrives, having had his bullet wound patched by Jo, and Bobby starts an exorciasm. but there is a binding symbol on Sams arm, so the exorcism fails, cracking the devil's trap open. Dean learns it is the same Demon who possessed Meg, and it's about to kill him when Bobby burns the binding symbol, forcing the demon out. Bobby gives the brothers charm amulets to prevent future possessions. Sam is pissed that Dean woulden't shoot him when he was evil, but Dean says he is going to save Sam not kill him.



</answer>



<asker's comment>



Awesome. Thanks :)



</asker's comment>
